website_summaries.verdict: A bundle that includes 2 blends designed to mimic granular white sugar and confectioner’s sugar. Perfect duo for bakers.
pros: Contains a healthy combination of erythitrol and oligosaccharides
The substitutes include prebiotic fiber which aids in digestion and has a low glycemic impact
No need to adjust ingredient ratios
cons: Some reports of gastrointestinal side effects and an unpleasant aftertaste

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, too small of a package.
customer_reviews.text: It tastes alright but they need a bigger package. This is only a cup and a half and if you're using it as a sugar substitute in baking/recipes that are calling for 1C of sugar and Swerve is a 1:1 ratio, it gets wayyyyy too expensive to reasonably use this as a long term substitute compared to plain stevia. I understand the benefits but I can't get behind the price per ounce, OVER $1. So each cup is $8. WOW!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Causes extreme gastric upset
customer_reviews.text: Gastric upset was an understatement. I put it in various things before realizing this is what was making my children and I so ill. I cannot consume this. It’s as bad as sugar free gummy bears.
customer_reviews.author: Twin Mom

customer_reviews.title: High price
customer_reviews.text: I actually love this product. It tastes great and doesn't leave an aftertaste. It requires slightly more to get the same sweetness as you would from regular sugar or sugar substitutes, however. The reason for the 3 stars is pricing. I can get one bag of Swerve at a local grocery for less than $8 per bag. That's where I'll be buying from now on.
customer_reviews.author: C. Flagg

customer_reviews.title: Stomach issues
customer_reviews.text: I had a tablespoon to a tablespoon and a half and it gave me terrible stomach issues. The taste isn't great but it isn't terrible for an artificial sweetener. I do not recommend if you have a sensitive stomach.
customer_reviews.author: TravelQueen

customer_reviews.title: Small small bags
customer_reviews.text: Was very surprised when I received these bags of swerves. The swerves are 12 oz bags, and the stevia is 9.7 oz bags. Swerve bags are way smaller, and bags aren't even filled half way. Will never order again!
customer_reviews.author: francis

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: This could just be a personal reaction, but my mouth almost felt cold/minty while eating cookies I made with this. Next day I had tons of blisters. Bummed this will go to waste.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Cha cha cha
customer_reviews.text: Some people think it's cool but others got some rapid stool When you're walking in the park and your dog begins to bark Some people think it's gross others think it's great on toast
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Ragweed sensitives may have a reaction to this sweetener
customer_reviews.text: There needs to be a warning on this product that it's made from a plant in the ragweed family. If you have a severe allergy to ragweed (which i do) then you may have a reaction to any sweetener made with Stevia. I found this out the hard way by making Ragweed Brownies. :(
customer_reviews.author: Sleonhard

customer_reviews.title: After taste is horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try a different sweetener being on the keto diet. I normally use xylitol, but since it's toxic to dogs I decided on Swerve. I made the keto cheesecake fat bombs that I normally make. They weren't as sweet with Swerve and kinda tasted funny. The worst part was the after taste! My mouth tingled for hours and tasted like a chemical. I couldn't get rid of the taste no matter what. I'm just disappointed I got the 2 pack because I can't even return the one I didn't open.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a fan
customer_reviews.text: I used the sweetner (not confectioners) to make no-bake cookies. This may not have been a right way to use it as 1:1 as with sugar. With several diabetics in the family, just thought I'd try it before baking a bunch of other things for Christmas. The sweetner has an odd taste, and leaves an after-taste. Even after drinking water... it makes the water taste sweet.
customer_reviews.author: RéOnFire

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Extra Money
customer_reviews.text: I usually use straight erythritol and bought this because I needed sweetener faster than I could get my usual brand shipped. The granular tastes really good and has a texture that is more like sugar than straigh erythritol has. The confectioners is wonderful. I dusted some low carb brownies with it, and it made a huge difference in how well they were received by my husband and son. The bundle is a little expensive, but I will definitely buy more of the confectioners when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: A bitter - No Thank You!
customer_reviews.text: For both my husband and I, this product was a big NO. Terrible aftertaste and we suffered it only as long as it took to get the Bochasweet back in the sugar bowl. I suppose taste buds are different for each person and Swerve may work for others, but it was an expensive fail for us.
customer_reviews.author: TKay

customer_reviews.title: The aftertaste is awful.
customer_reviews.text: I followed Jane Barthelemy's (Jane's Healthy Kitchen) suggestions for paleo sweeteners because I did the keto diet for two weeks. Barthelemy suggests using "Swerve" and "Just Like Sugar." Serve aftertaste is awful - cero pleasant sweetness. I just used one teaspoon of honey for my coffee during my keto diet and gave away the two packets of "Swerve" I bought. I lost 10 pounds using a small amount of honey. I also bought her other suggestion - "Just Like Sugar Table Top Sweetener," which is just as bad as "Swerve."
customer_reviews.author: Bernardo Bernal

customer_reviews.title: It's gross
customer_reviews.text: Its disgusting. Like really really bad. It took hours for the aftertaste to go away. I had originally purchased to attempt a macaron made with a sugar substitute. This is not it. I knew it was a long shot because of the chemistry but i figured I'd try. I made the mistake of tasting the mixture to see if i should try to make SOMETHING out of it and spent the next two hours hating my own mouth. The search continues!
customer_reviews.author: Anola Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on this kind of supplemental sugar for a keto diet. Lots of reviews were positive. I’m sensitive to ‘sugar free’ items and all the fake junk they put in it. Naturally, I was very skeptical. I made chocolate chip cookies using the brown sugar and granulated sugar. My entire family were having stomach issues within an hour! This smells weird and regardless what the package says, it leaves a weird taste in your mouth. Plus, for the cost......you get 1lb which equals about 2 cups, MAYBE 2 1/2. A 5 lb bag of regular granulated sugar is only a few dollars. I’m all about eating healthier but this is simply not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: mommyreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Burns so good.
customer_reviews.text: Beware the burn. This sweetener burns my throat a bit, especially if the food is cold or warm. Room temperature is tolerable for some reason. The taste is great and it doesn't spike my blood sugar, so for that reason alone I will purchase again. Be aware you'll only get enough sweetener for 1 full sized dessert out of a bag, so if you're planning to use it for holiday baking (like I was) you'll need more than one of whichever type your recipe requires.
customer_reviews.author: KH Bone

customer_reviews.title: Makes me feel sick
customer_reviews.text: I made a simple Keto dessert using this from a well known Keto blogger. Couldn’t figure out why I was getting congested and feeling like an onset of a cold was coming. This sugar was doing something to my mouth, throat and sinuses. Threw out both packages. Would never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: D Emm

customer_reviews.title: WARNING - Stay near a bathroom!
customer_reviews.text: If you like having diarrhea for two days or if you are constipated, then this is the product for you! Better yet...have some fun with it. Invite some friends & family over, enough to where there are more people than bathrooms. Feed it to everyone and let the games begin!
customer_reviews.author: JWalker

customer_reviews.title: DIET? WHAT DIET? THIS CAN'T BE A DIET!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet! Literally. I make some of the best Keto friendly desserts with Swerve. Both the confectioners and granulated do a superior job of replacing sugar in your foods without the laxative side effects of other sugar replacements. I use this to make a Keto friendly cheesecake that is better than the low carb version from The Cheesecake Factory. Being able to make and eat delicious desserts makes sticking to my way of eating easy. Thanks to Swerve, I no longer feel I'm missing out.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Leaves weird cooling effect & texture in mouth
customer_reviews.text: Yuck. Leaves a weird cooling effect & smooth texture coats the inside of my mouth. It’s just weird. With that said... Cannot even use these for anything bc they taste horrible. I suspect this is just a personal preference rather than a defect in product, but still...not today, Satan.
customer_reviews.author: Krysie B

customer_reviews.title: Super strong tasting and cooks fast
customer_reviews.text: YUCK, EWWW. This sucks 100%. We have a baking business and wanted to try a new diabetic sugar for our sugar-free customers. The stuff was O.K. tasting alone but not close to a sugar taste and that it ruined the flavors of our cupcakes. On top of that the sugar Burns awfully fast and turns your cakes hard as rock. Might be good for other products but not cakes
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mahoski

customer_reviews.title: Felt like Id eaten poison or draino.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the taste was ok but I felt like I'd eaten poison all day afterward. Stomach and abdominal pain as if draino were going through my intestine. Gas and bloating, nausea and liquid diarrhea for hours afterward. Tried 3x just to be sure it was from this product with same outcome.
customer_reviews.author: bosonlove

customer_reviews.title: Flavor is pleasant unlike Stevia.
customer_reviews.text: I initially ordered this product si feo began Keto diet. I hate the taste of diet sodas and I hate the taste of stevia 🤢. I was afraid to order this sweeter since it was hard to believe It wouldn’t taste like a sugar free sweetner. I decided to place an order and take my chances. When my package arrived the first thing I made was a cup of bullet proof coffee and OMG I was soooooo happy to finally find a sugar replacement that didn’t taste bad or spiked my glucose. I will be buying more of this.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Guillen

customer_reviews.title: Do not put in your airline luggage!
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to use in recipes like salad dressing, coleslaw, and pudding - anything that is served cold. I do not like it in baked goods because it causes a weird cold feeling in my mouth. I'll continue to use Swerve, but only with cold recipes. On another note: today I got searched at airport security. I had a bag of Swerve in my carry-on suitcase. It was wiped and came out positive for explosives. Needless to say, it was a bit tense after that. After the SFO explosives expert examined my Swerve and tested it, I was in the clear. He said that that has happened before at the airport. Beware what you pack!
customer_reviews.author: M. Schalock

customer_reviews.title: I personally do not like this product and have thrown out several things I ...
customer_reviews.text: I personally do not like this product and have thrown out several things I have made with it. I know it is others choice but I prefer Splenda by far.
customer_reviews.author: Pat in MT

customer_reviews.title: Laxative effect. Watch out
customer_reviews.text: So the taste is great. Was cool that it didn’t have any aftertaste. Looks like sugar and tastes like sugar. BUT. I used 1 cup to make low carb coconut/lemon bread. Was great until about 3 hours afterward. I ate two pieces and then hung out in the bathroom the rest of the evening. My stomachs didn’t actually hurt but this stuff went right through me. I lost 3 pounds..so there’s that. It makes a good laxative if you’re looking for one. The only way I’ll ever use this again is maybe a teaspoon of it in some coffee but I’m too afraid to try it again right now.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B

customer_reviews.title: Don't understand the hype.  Need A LOT to get a sweet flavor.
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand what all the rave is about this product. I added a heaping spoonful to my coffee this morning and could barely taste sweetness. Added half more. Not much better. For the amount you need to get sweetness (and no, it does not taste like sugar...it's still different) this if pretty expensive. Will not be buying again. I guess tomorrow I'll try two heaping spoons...then three heaping spoonfuls, then the bag will be gone.
customer_reviews.author: shellmrtn

customer_reviews.title: Best artificial sweetener I've tried!
customer_reviews.text: I am doing low carb and other artificial sweeteners still make your blood sugar spike. This was recommended and I just got them today. Both the granulated sugar and powdered sugar have the same texture as real and both do the trick for me. I'm using in my coffee and to bake with almond flour or blend with cream cheese, but I havent gotten that far yet. My first take on them is that they are very expensive, but worth it for the quality!
customer_reviews.author: S. King

customer_reviews.title: Best sweetener
customer_reviews.text: Tastes almost as sweet as sugar, no bitter aftertaste, can truly be used in a 1:1 ratio for all recipes calling for sugar. I've used granulated, confectioners, and brown sugar variety and all are amazing. Use confectioners for anything that needs to dissolve fully, the others won't really dissolve well. Doesn't give me any digestive problems, even my sugar loving friends and family can't tell the difference when I use this to bake or cook for them. I don't tell them their treats are sugar-free and they love what I make for them. This stuff helped me kick my sugar addiction and I'm a regular customer now. Wish you could buy it in bulk amounts since it is expensive.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Much Better than Stevia
customer_reviews.text: Started the Keto lifestyle recently and made a dessert recipe with Stevia, then promptly threw it away it tasted so nasty. Learned about Swerve from a Facebook Keto group and decided to give it a try. Wow!! What a difference. Still not just like sugar but at least I'm not throwing away food anymore. Hardly any aftertaste, and what there is, is kind of a cool feeling in your mouth when you exhale.
customer_reviews.author: KimmieJ

customer_reviews.title: Gross Gross Gross
customer_reviews.text: I’m keto and was looking forward to using this “new” sweetener. This is just plain old disgusting, burn-your-mouth erythritol that you’ve always hated. Had to throw out a batch of labor-intensive cookies due to the cooling, burning mouth sensation.
customer_reviews.author: Megan S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect non-nutrative sweetener.
customer_reviews.text: Swerve is a great sugar replacement for those on low-carb or ketogenic diets. It has no aftertaste, however, depending on how much you use, it can have a cooling effect in the mouth due to the sugar alcohols. I find it is better suited for cold foods as the cooling effect is felt more with my hot coffee. I haven't used it in baking yet to see how well it keeps the texture and moisture in baked goods. The confectioners texture is better for cold foods or making cake icing while the granular texture works fine for hot foods like coffee or tea.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: This product came highly recommended by a nutritionist
customer_reviews.text: This product came highly recommended by a nutritionist, and I have to say I'm so glad I tried it. It does indeed work just like sugar--no special measurements required. I have never detected the aftertaste that so often comes with sugar substitutes. When I use Serve or gift baked goods, I don't even think to mention I used a diet substitute because it tastes so good. I will continue to buy Swerve, although I hope the price comes down as the product becomes more well known.
customer_reviews.author: BosMA

customer_reviews.title: Confectioners Swerve bag arrived open.
customer_reviews.text: Luckily the Seller double bags this before shipping. The package of Confectioners Swerve was open. The bag of Granulated was fine. Not sure whether it is safe to use or not. Very expensive at $24 for the two bags. I hate to just throw it away. It's been longer then the 30 day return so not sure if the Seller will do anything. I opened the Granulated a while ago but didn't even look at the Confectioners until today. Not very happy. The Swerve products taste okay although I like the Monkfruit Sweetener much better. This still has a tiny bit of bitter after taste but much better than Stevia.
customer_reviews.author: Siameez

customer_reviews.title: Sugar Sub Sensitivity - gave me a major case of hives!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I had an unknown sensitivity to this product and simply touching and handling the product left me with a major case of hives! I did not realize I had this sensitivity until I used the product! This product came highly recommend by fellow keto dieters but when I did more research, I did finally find that there were a number of people who had a fair amount of sensitivity to this specific super substitute, as well as others. While I did not have a positive experience with this product, that doesn't mean it won't suit someone else's purpose - I would just caution someone before they use it!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Gregorek

customer_reviews.title: Healthy sweetener
customer_reviews.text: I love cooking with Swerve when I’m trying to eat healthy/low-carb. I have used it in fudge and banana bread with no problems or strange after-taste. Sometimes I add this to my oatmeal as well. UPDATE: Don't overeat too much! I normally do fine with sugar alcohols, but anytime I've overeaten foods made with Swerve, my stomach aches for several hours afterward. Just be smart and eat normal-sized portions. I have learned the hard way!
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Zimmerle

customer_reviews.title: Convenient into to this type of sweetener
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use in some Keto style recipes. Erythritol is supposed to be good for baking, but I found that it burned and the finished product did not taste sweet enough. Seems like it looses sweetness in the oven. The granular version is VERY difficult to dissolve, so recommend using it in something that is wet and will be mixed for a long time. I made some really good Keto Eggnog with the granular Swerve. The powdered is easier to dissolve but can also remain gritty if not adequately mixed. My second purchase was only powdered and a different brand. Both styles of Swerve are available at Whole Foods for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Horrid!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product! Causes intense bloating, constipation & stomach pain...tastes horrid! Aftertaste in mouth stayed for a week despite regular brushing & mouthwash use! Causes too much discomfort to digestive system, did not expect it - will never buy again, waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: UQ

customer_reviews.title: Weird menthol like thing going on
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be an answer to my prayers. I was looking for a sweetener without a terrible aftertaste. This sweetener tastes like it has menthol in it because it had a cooling sensation. I read that after I got the bag but so many people on Weight Watchers bake with this, I thought it would work. It sucks that you can't return it is you don't like it. The one bag isn't open.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Looks like sugar.... Bakes like sugar. Does not taste like sugar
customer_reviews.text: I made the prettiest chocolate cake with fluffy chocolate frosting. Beautiful. OMG! The taste was SO awful! Spent a lot of money on those ingredients. For anyone trying this product, I strongly suggest making something small first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.  Good price.
customer_reviews.text: I have recently switched over to a low carb diet. I purchased this package of confectioners and granular Swerve. It is a nice sweetener. I like it better than the plain Erythritol. The cooling effect is still present but not as severe as with the Erythritol. I've added a picture of the confectioners vs the granular. The bags have a resealable ziplock which is great for keeping it fresh. I've used this in multiple types of recipes and had nice results in all: Low carb muffins Mounds fat bombs Easy Lemon Fat bombs
customer_reviews.author: iloveshoppingonine

customer_reviews.title: I wasnt sure what to expect
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect from this - and I was a bit nervous about it being ALL erythritol. But so far - at least in the quantities I have been using it - I have had zero upset stomach. So that's good. However I will say that of ALL the sugar subs I still prefer chicory root (Just like sugar) hands down over all the other ones. JLS literally tastes and acts just like sugar! It is always my first choice and I believe its pricing is much better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great bundle price for two necessary sugar substitutes.
customer_reviews.text: Great bundle of two necessary items if you are trying to have a positive impact on your health. The taste of Swerve is somewhat less bitter than other alternative sweeteners. I feel good by using it instead of regular sugar products. There is too much sugar is ALL products sold at grocery stores. No one needs sugar in their bread!! I wish manufacturers would use Swerve instead of regular processed sugar of any kind. Very happy with this selection. Be healthy and eliminate sugar from your diet and that of your children. Use Swerve!
customer_reviews.author: TLW

customer_reviews.title: Stomach Upset
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to reduce my sugar intake but after using it to bake multiple things I began to realize I was always horribly sick with stomach upsets (etc...) after each time I used it. I always had to dump the goodies I baked with it and I've been terrified of using it since those early attempts. Complete waste of money. If you are at all sensitive to sugar alcohols or prone to GI issues maybe steer clear and grab some stevia instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kay28

customer_reviews.title: After-taste
customer_reviews.text: I'm on Keto like I'm sure many of the purchasers are but I cannot stand the aftertaste of this product! IDK if I am just more sensitive to it because every Keto recipe I come across calls for this product and Keto veterans swear by it. My kids and parents taste the aftertaste too when I whip something up for them. I'm happy I found powered monk fruit instead by Lankanto which actually has 0 net carbs and truly has no aftertaste whereas Swerve as 1 net carb and a strong aftertaste.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Love Swerve!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So glad to finally find a sweetner that tastes good, has no aftertaste like some others do, no tummy issues. I'm on Keto and I was a sugar addict. I was very worried when going on Keto I would have these terrible sugars I've tasted before and hated till I found Swerve. I cook, bake, use in coffee, teas, etc. The only thing if you drink something afterwards it tastes very sweet. It's weird.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had never used swerve before. I used spenda. After reading the negatives on splenda, i decided to give swerve a try. Tastes similar to sugar and a much healthier option. I have tried the confectioners sugar and the brown sugar alternatives and are happy with them as well. However, I recently tried erythritol and I think that is my preference. It tastes just like sugar.
customer_reviews.author: goldenkey59

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: The granulated swerve is not super sweet so if you are looking for a "sugar" substitute, try monkfruit sweetener. The confectioners swerve is perfect! I used the granulated swerve in my coffee and it took the bitter taste away but was not overly sweet. I used the confectioners swerve in my carrot cake with cream cheese icing and it was delicious! The icing was perfectly sweetened without being overly sweet. Both products are fantastic and do not have an aftertaste at all, which I love!
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Consistently good taste and texture
customer_reviews.text: I've tried crystallized, powdered and brown sugar versions of Swerve and it consistently delivers the quality taste and texture I want. I have experienced digestive bloating and gas, but I still prefer it over real sugar since it doesn't contribute to high blood sugar. Mixes just as well as real sugar and in about the same quantity. The taste is like sugar, but since it is a sugar alcohol, there is a bit of a cold sensation on the tongue as an after-effect. This may bother some people, but I'm used to it and it doesn't bother me at all. It can be a little expensive if you use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Angie H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative
customer_reviews.text: I love how I can bake and eat sweets with this sugar alternative without having all the guilt. Tastes great! I did notice a bit of the "cooling aftertaste" like most artificial sweeteners have, but it is mild and definitely not as strong as others. Both the confectioners and granular sugar are so similar to the real thing in texture and flavor.
customer_reviews.author: SherBear

customer_reviews.title: So good but I'm alergic
customer_reviews.text: I was so hoping to love this sweetner. I would give it a 5 star straight because the taste was amazing. Unfortunately I became very Ill with this. Unfortunately I have an alergy to it. Damn damn damn! It was so good. I'm one of the few than cannot have erythitol. Probably didn't spell it right. That's the only reason I took away one star. I don't feel good about taking it because it no fault of this product. I had to give both bags to my mother who loves it. Guess I'll have to find another sweetner.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs moisture like a sponge.
customer_reviews.text: This came in a resealable heavy plastic bag inside a resealable plastic bag. I put those inside 2 resealable ziplock freezer bags. It still absorbed so much moisture (I live in a humid climate) that it turned into one big lump. I am not at all pleased in this poor packaging of the product. The taste was fine when I used it the ONE TIME. Next time I went to use it, it was ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Love is Called Swerve
customer_reviews.text: I am following a Keto lifestyle and am a good baker who loves to bake. I was looking for a good sugar substitute when I stumbled into Swerve. Not only does it measures and taste like sugar, it doesn’t have the horrible after taste of Stevia. Thank you Swerve for saving my Keto life. The product arrived sooner than it was expected. I plain to get all my Swerve here.
customer_reviews.author: Hala M. El-Tonbary

customer_reviews.title: Best sweetener EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AWESOME!! I cannot wait to start baking with it! There is no after taste what so ever, except a mild cool sensation in your mouth when you inhale but that last just a second. I have had ZERO gut distress with it, as is common with other sugar alcohols. I am really blown away with how much this tastes like sugar. I licked it off my finger when it first arrived to "test" it and it is a little bit less sweet than sugar, but has the same taste and texture (granular). It is a little pricey but it's worth it for my blood sugar and low carb life style!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: a great help for those trying to cut down on sugar
customer_reviews.text: Swerve products are really helping me on the low carb/keto diet. I haven't fully gotten rid of my sweet cravings so I use Swerve and it doesn't affect my blood glucose. The oligosaccharide added to erythritol means it is more equivalent in baking. This is not sold in my local grocery store so I was happy to find it on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Seed Chomper

customer_reviews.title: Hate the aftertaste
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the aftertaste of this type of sweetener, but as I've been on Keto longer it is becoming slightly more tolerable. I cut the sugar back in any recipe that uses this to help with the aftertaste, but still maintain some sweetness. I read somewhere but have yet to try that some people say to cut back the swerve a little and add some liquid stevia, this combination helps balance out both sweeteners odd tastes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Send

customer_reviews.title: Made my brownies taste awful!
customer_reviews.text: Confectioners sugar (used for icing) has a cooling effect as if minty which is weird. And the brownies made with the granulated version had a bad flavor! Worst $15 I ever spent...
customer_reviews.author: IHeartPank

customer_reviews.title: There’s no disgusting after taste AT ALL!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely cannot stand the aftertaste of artificial or substitute sweeteners but Swerve...wow...I had to look at the label a couple times to make sure this really is a legit keto friendly item. It tastes SO GREAT!!! My recipes and I are greatful for this item. Also when I ordered I was given the expected delivery day of Monday but it delivered on Sunday. I got to start making my delicious desserts a day early!! All around awesomeness!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Best natural sugar alternative out there!
customer_reviews.text: Great value! Love that I can get both kinds with one click! Arrived promptly and nicely bagged so no issues with damage. You can’t beat this product for a sweetener for low carb, Keto, diabetic or someone who just wants to cut sugar out! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, natural sweetener
customer_reviews.text: This was my first experience with Swerve. It was recommended in several recipes as Keto-friendly. It measures and tastes like sugar, and best of all is good for baking. The confectioners mixes better than the granular, which doesn't dissolve readily. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Great sugar substitute without any funny after taste or bad health reactions
customer_reviews.text: This 2 for 1 of Swerve (Erythritol) is a pretty good value. I got one each of the granulated and the powdered version, which gives plenty of flexibility with cooking and baking keto/sugar-free treats. It doesn't have a funny after taste and no gastro issues with use. I'd love to be able to get the 2 for 1 with 1 powdered and 1 brown sugar too.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Sugar

customer_reviews.title: Very tasty
customer_reviews.text: I do not use this sweetener very often because I'm trying to cut back on sweets, but I like this natural sweetener better than any other I have tried. I think the price is high, but justify it because I'm the only one that eats it, I don't eat it often, and it is helping with my new way of eating that is helping to prevent diabetes and weight gain (keto). I have not tried the confectioner Swerve yet as this is my first time to order it. This is my second bag of the granular Swerve.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper's MomTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Faulty packaging leaks contents everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived open and the contents were completely emptied into the Amazon packaging. There is no way to request a refund because it is a food item. I'm sure it is a decent sweetener from what I tasted on my fingers after opening the shipping packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole H

customer_reviews.title: Best option for baking low carb or keto diet bakery items
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product I've found for baking low carb or keto bakery items. It acts very much like real sugar and everything tastes great. I order from Amazon because it's the same price or lower than I can find in local grocery stores.
customer_reviews.author: GandYMac

customer_reviews.title: Horrid after taste that lasts hours
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to try this as lot of people said it had no after taste... Don't believe it. It's definitely sweet but for me leaves a weird after taste and then makes everything I eat or drink even water taste ungodly sweet for hours. Wishing I could return it but seeing as I used half of it trying to make several things thinking maybe it was just the thing I made, that's not an option.
customer_reviews.author: spiritrunner

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so, my hubby was recently diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. I immediately went on the hunt for a sugar replacement. This one is by far the most closely resembling sugar, and bakes like sugar. It does have a rather slight after taste, but hubby gave the cake I made the thumbs up. I, on the other hand, really don't care for it. There is an ever so slight aftertaste that has put me off it, but it is the most passable substitute we've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but the best sugar substitute I have tasted
customer_reviews.text: I made a couple of sugar free, keto cheesecake for a coworker on a strict diet. I was impressed with the taste and how easy this product was to bake with, not all artificial sweeteners are equal. No one else on the team knew they were sugar free, the treats were a hit. I wish it wasn't so expensive, because I would keep it as a regular pantry item but now I know what to use when making a treat for those who can't eat sugar
customer_reviews.author: Bayles

customer_reviews.title: Aftertaste
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great product--it certainly costs enough. But I find the taste very unpleasant. It leaves an aftertaste as most artificial sweeteners do but this one seems particularly bad to me. Should have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, next!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this two stars because it is two products. The confection sugar and the granulated. I can tell you immediately that the taste is not sweet, it tastes more like minty alcohol. Not as bad as while eating the item you used it in as AFTER!! I am not a person who drinks any alcohols and that is all I can taste in this product. My cousin, who is less into sweet-tasting products than I am finds it minty and likes it. I can't eat this....I think it has a horrible after taste.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ezekiel-Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Horrible taste
customer_reviews.text: This is no substitute for splenda on a low carb diet. The taste is not sweet like splenda. If you're looking for that alternative, nope.
customer_reviews.author: goofyfoot

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommends this brand for baking and I’ve found it to be great for that. Yes it costs a lot but really, we shouldn’t be doing all that much baking since “concentrated carbs” - including root flours - tend to displace the large amounts of vegetables we should be eating every day.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Made me horribly sick
customer_reviews.text: We were debating calling an ambulance that’s how sick it made me. Horrible product, tasted like the most fake chemical sweetener I’ve ever had. Threw it all away
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Best artificial sweetener
customer_reviews.text: So these are expensive but they are the best artificial sweeteners I’ve ever tried. I tried stevia and it was disgusting. But Swerve is actually tasty. The only thing I don’t like is it’s a bit higher in price than what I would like, if I wanted to buy it on a regular basis
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: No calories but it does have carbs!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tasting low calorie sweetener I've ever had. It has just a little bit of aftertaste, and if you're counting carbs, it does have a few per serving so you still need to be careful with how much you eat. But you will be tempted to eat a lot of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sugar alternative
customer_reviews.text: As a home baker that has gone keto, Swerve is a great sugar alternative. Zero net carbs and it works really similar to sugar. I have used it to make creme brulee and meringue cookies and I have been so impressed. It can leave a bit of an aftertaste, but that's something I'm willing to live with if I can keep baking tasty treats!
customer_reviews.author: Beatnik

customer_reviews.title: Great taste, horrible longevity, confectioners doesn't whip.
customer_reviews.text: I buy swerve all the time. What I got was fresh, well packaged. However, even after closing the package AND storing in additional zip lock bag, the regular granular became one big clump. Confectioners was used to make macaroons. While it tasted great, it didn't whip up properly like real sugar....
customer_reviews.author: Kimfit

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get past tingle and aftertaste
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive sweetener and it leaves a tingle/cool feeling in your mouth. Just not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco D'anconia

customer_reviews.title: Not for me!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the taste of this product. I didn't notice an aftertaste at all. I did notice a cooling sensation in my mouth which I could have dealt with. However, about 10 minutes after consuming this product I got a terrible headache and started feeling dizzy. I also had stomach upset later that day. I won't be using the remainder of this product. It is probably just as well because it was too expensive for the amount of product you receive.
customer_reviews.author: HWL

customer_reviews.title: Great paleo sugar with 0 cal  tastes great>
customer_reviews.text: new to a paleo diet thats working great for me, giving up grains and sugar i turned to this to be able to make myself paleo cookies with almond flour and 0 cal sweetner, this works so well one can hardly tell its not sugar. i used sugar free choc chips i ordere dfrom Amazon too and have made myself the most scrumptious cookies ever!
customer_reviews.author: Monkeypony

customer_reviews.title: Best sugar replacement I've found
customer_reviews.text: I'm a southern girl and I LOVE MY SWEET TEA!!!! Unfortunately going carb free means sugar is out of the picture. BUT NOW I can have my Tea and drink it too!!! Expensive but my husband reminded me it is still cheaper than my large McDonalds sweet tea I was buying every day. No funky aftertaste like Truvia and Stevia. They have it at my local Publix for about the same price but they don't deliver
customer_reviews.author: L. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Heaven
customer_reviews.text: I can’t tolerate the taste of Stevia so I gave this a try. I bought both the confection as well as the granules and they are both sweet without an aftertaste. I have a baked with these and added them to anything that needs sweetener. It also doesn’t affect my keto diet which means this is a win-win for me!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Tasty!
customer_reviews.text: Best fatbombs EVER after I used this instead of Stevia drops! BARF 🤢 Recipe in picture but I don't use the salt!
customer_reviews.author: HABrooks

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm maybe not
customer_reviews.text: Swerve is expensive.......but I was willing to purchase it and try to bake using it. Most cookies and breads I’ve made using it have not turned out well. They are usually dry and crumbly. Not sure I’ll purchase again. It is also very grainy and doesn’t mix well.
customer_reviews.author: Nursietj

customer_reviews.title: Very good flavor
customer_reviews.text: This sweetener is the closest to real sugar that I have ever tried, as far as flavor goes, but is pricey. You also cannot leave it out in a sugar bowl, as it hardens quickly. I just keep it in the bag in which it comes and then make sure I seal up the bag after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E. Stonaha

customer_reviews.title: No insulin spike, no bitter aftertaste
customer_reviews.text: I've made creme brulee and other desserts with Swerve. I was shocked that I could caramelize it with my torch! It doesn't taste entirely like caramelized sugar though - more like a sugar-free xylitol candy or something like that... but it's so much better than spiking my insulin, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the powdered and the granule. No after taste, does not raise my glucose level, I placed in an old spice jar so I could use the spoon or sprinkle side. I also used the powdered on top of strawberries to sweeten. Does take a bit more than regular sugar (measurement wise).
customer_reviews.author: Dotti

customer_reviews.title: Makes occasional baked goods "legal" and healthy
customer_reviews.text: All these products are very pricey that is the biggest drawback BUT i won't be using them often as they are so good it feels like i'm cheating BUT that's a good thing. I can now make a cake with real icing using the powdered form, haven't tried the brown version in this brand. Can be a part of a health lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Better than sugar, better for you!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best alternative sugar substitute that I know of. I don’t consume sugar, for no other reason then it’s just terrible for you. We make all sorts of delicious desserts now and you honestly wouldn’t know that it doesn’t have sugar in it. I love the stuff, and I used to be a pastry chef.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great without an aftertaste
customer_reviews.text: Just started keto and am having a hard time adjusting to sugar free life. This product has helped considerably! Tastes great without an aftertaste. BUT when in warm liquids, I notice that I feel a sweetness in my mouth/on my teeth when I inhale. Better than an aftertaste so I will stick with this for now. I use the confectioners more than the granular, but I am happy I bought both. Measures just like sugar!
customer_reviews.author: Waleed

customer_reviews.title: It’s icky!
customer_reviews.text: The aftertaste was hor ri ble!! I need to lose weight, but never this bad! I’ll stick to stevia and monk fruit. I gave it to a friend. Expensive as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anny Won

customer_reviews.title: Taste like alcohol
customer_reviews.text: I follow the Keto diet. I bought this to make a chocolate treat. I couldn't even eat it. It had such a strong alcohol taste.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The confectionery sugar bakes really well. What I didn't like was the granulated. The minute I opened the bag I got a strong chemical smell. Despite this I put a teaspoon in my coffee just to try it as the description said it measures just like sugar. It doesn't as there was no sweetness in my coffee. So I threw it and my coffee out.
customer_reviews.author: C. England

customer_reviews.title: So Good
customer_reviews.text: I seriously love this stuff! I've been keto since May and have been using Swerve to bake for the last several months now. Honestly if you're used to sugar and you jump right into trying this product then you won't like it. But if you haven't had sugar in a while, this tastes like heaven. It bakes really nicely too and curbs that craving without feeling like cap after. I do however wish it was a bit less expensive, since I bake A LOT
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Only out of necessity
customer_reviews.text: Overwhelming artificial and sweet taste. I tried it in a cappuccino and for baking. I am sure many people love it given the 4.5 star rating. I cut my normal amount in half and was still much too sweet and the artificial taste lingered for quite a long time.
customer_reviews.author: mrssmiley

customer_reviews.title: Taste
customer_reviews.text: Tried this product in my morning coffee. Terrible taste, cant return. Should be able to get money back for a bad taste review. I wish I could give 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne Silva

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful texture and no strange aftertaste.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this sweetener. I tried Erythritol, Xylitol, and Stevia in my search for a good tasting, natural, low calorie sweetener. This is the best I have tasted. It has none of the strange cooling effect of Erythritol, no aftertaste like Stevia, and is the texture of real sugar (unlike Xylitol). I will definitely be keeping this in my pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Wilcoxcd

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Keep these on hand for Keto recipes. Measures just like sugar and no funky aftertaste.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Great for baking!
customer_reviews.text: Great for baking. The plastic ziplock sometimes has trouble staying closed so some moisture gets in the granular package and makes it solid. The taste, when added to coffee or tea, has an aftertaste (similar to exhaling crystal lite) that I can not stand. When baking, no aftertaste.
customer_reviews.author: alfe

customer_reviews.title: Won't order again because of pricing - not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: The powdered swerve is a GREAT addition for baking but not so great to use as a Tablespoon sweetener (like for tea and coffee). There is a cooling aftertaste with Swerve but ti worked great for my peanut butter cookies. I only got two batches though because it's such a small package. I can't find it locally and my only option is online ordering. The price is too much, I won't be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: missylissac

customer_reviews.title: I like that it's the same measurements as sugar
customer_reviews.text: I like that it's the same measurements as sugar, and it was very easy to use. I only give it 4 stars because if you use it as a glaze (I baked a keto pound cake with the granular and used the confectioners to mix with lemon juice for a glaze), it's a little "cold" feeling. This isn't uncommon for some of the sugar alcohol substitutes.
customer_reviews.author: dragonfly

product_meta.title: Swerve Sweetener, Bakers Bundle, Granular and Confectioners, 12 Ounce, pack of 2
feature_bullets: BAKE & FROST YOUR CAKE: Have your sugar replacement pantry staples with a bag of Granular for replacing white table sugar and a bag of Confectioners for replacing powdered sugar.
TASTES AMAZING: Swerve is sweet and delicious. It is a natural sugar replacement that doesn’t have the bitter aftertaste associated with other sweeteners like stevia and monkfruit.
MEASURES LIKE SUGAR: If your recipe calls for a cup of sugar, simply replace with a cup of Swerve. Since it measures just like sugar, using Swerve in your favorite recipes will be a breeze.
ZERO NET CARBS: The ingredients in Swerve don’t affect blood sugar, so the carbohydrates it contains are considered non-impact.
NON-GMO VERIFIED: Only the highest quality ingredients are used.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
